faculty.note: The Faculty of Business trains students for professional careers in accounting, human resource management, marketing and ICT, with strong emphasis on practical skills and entrepreneurship aligned with Ghanaian and global industry needs. [web:41][web:52][web:55]

career: Finance Officer in SMEs and NGOs

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 18,000 - GHS 24,000 per year (estimated from private business degree bands around USD 1,500 - 2,000)

salary.Ghana: GHS 36,000 - GHS 80,000 per year (entry to mid-level accounting roles)

levels.cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate 18 - 30 for private business programmes, with stronger aggregates preferred for accounting options
levels.mode: In-person lectures and tutorials with case studies, group projects and use of accounting software; some blended online resources.
levels.entry_requirements: WASSCE/SSSCE applicants are generally required to have credit passes in six subjects, including three core subjects (English Language, Core Mathematics and a science subject such as Integrated Science or Social Studies) and three business-related electives such as Accounting, Business Management, Economics or Elective Mathematics, with an overall aggregate around 24 - 36. Mature applicants must typically be at least 25 years old and pass a mature entrance examination as outlined in the School of Business entry requirements. [web:46][web:55]
levels.level_note: The programme provides a solid grounding in financial and management accounting, taxation, auditing and corporate finance. Students are prepared for entry-level professional roles and further certification with bodies such as ICAG and ACCA.

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 18,000 - GHS 24,000 per year (estimated similar to other business programmes)

salary.Ghana: GHS 30,000 - GHS 70,000 per year (HR roles depending on organisation and experience)

levels.cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate 18 - 30 for business degrees at private universities
levels.mode: In-person classroom teaching with case discussions, role plays, presentations and group projects; some blended online learning.
levels.entry_requirements: Applicants normally need six WASSCE/SSSCE passes with an overall aggregate of about 24 or better, including credit passes in English Language, Core Mathematics and a science subject, plus three relevant electives such as Business Management, Economics, Elective Mathematics, Government or other approved arts and business subjects. Mature students must meet minimum age requirements and pass the institution’s mature entrance examinations. [web:46][web:55]
levels.level_note: The programme covers key HR areas including recruitment, performance management, labour law, employee relations and organisational behaviour. Graduates are prepared to support HR functions in corporate, public sector and NGO environments.

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 18,000 - GHS 24,000 per year (estimated for business-related programmes)

salary.Ghana: GHS 28,000 - GHS 65,000 per year (marketing and sales roles)

levels.cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate 18 - 30 with stronger grades in English and business-related electives
levels.mode: In-person lectures, presentations and project-based learning including campaign design and market research projects; supported by online tools.
levels.entry_requirements: Prospective students should hold passes in six WASSCE/SSSCE subjects with an aggregate generally not exceeding 24 - 36, including English Language, Core Mathematics and a science subject, plus three appropriate electives such as Business Management, Economics, Elective Mathematics, ICT or related arts subjects. Mature applicants must satisfy age, experience and examination requirements specified by the university. [web:46][web:55]
levels.level_note: The degree introduces students to principles of marketing, consumer behaviour, marketing communications, digital marketing and sales management. Emphasis is placed on creativity, analytical skills and practical exposure to Ghana’s business environment.

Mature candidates must meet minimum age and experience criteria and pass the required entrance examinations. [web:46][web:50][web:55]
levels.level_note: The ICT programme blends computer networking, databases, programming, systems administration and information systems concepts. Graduates are prepared for technical roles in corporate IT departments, SMEs and ICT service providers.

faculty.note: The Faculty of Fine Arts provides creative and industry-focused education in graphic and fashion design, combining artistic development with entrepreneurial and technical skills. [web:51][web:58]

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 18,000 - GHS 24,000 per year (estimated fine arts tuition band at private design-focused institutions)

salary.Ghana: GHS 24,000 - GHS 60,000 per year (agency and freelance design roles)

levels.cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate 18 - 30, with strong art portfolio and passes in visual art-related subjects
levels.mode: Studio-based, in-person teaching with project critiques, portfolio development and use of industry-standard design software; some online support for resources and submissions.
levels.entry_requirements: Applicants to fine arts programmes usually need passes in six WASSCE/SSSCE subjects including English Language, Core Mathematics and a science subject, plus three visual art-related electives such as Graphic Design, General Knowledge in Art, Picture Making, Textiles or other approved art subjects, with an aggregate typically not exceeding 24 - 36. levels.level_note: The programme covers fundamentals of design, typography, branding, illustration, digital imaging, interface design and packaging. Students build a professional portfolio suited to employment in design studios, advertising agencies and self-employment.

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 18,000 - GHS 24,000 per year (aligned with published private fashion design tuition bands)

required: Visual Art or Clothing and Textiles

salary.Ghana: GHS 24,000 - GHS 60,000 per year (highly variable based on entrepreneurship and brand success)

levels.cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate 18 - 30 with strong passes in textiles, clothing and other art-related subjects
levels.mode: Hands-on studio and workshop sessions in pattern making, garment construction and illustration, supplemented with lectures and business-focused modules.
levels.entry_requirements: Entry normally requires six WASSCE/SSSCE passes including English Language and Core Mathematics plus one of Integrated Science or Social Studies, and three electives in visual art, textiles, clothing and textiles, or related home economics and art subjects. levels.level_note: The BA Fashion Design programme emphasises creativity, technical skills and industry awareness, covering garment design, pattern cutting, production, fashion illustration and entrepreneurship. Graduates are equipped to work in Ghana’s growing fashion industry or to build their own brands.

faculty.note: The Faculty of Allied Science prepares students for clinical and laboratory roles in Ghana’s health sector through accredited programmes in physician assistantship, nursing and medical laboratory technology. [web:46]

career: Physician Assistant in Hospitals and Clinics
Emergency and Urgent Care Physician Assistant

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 22,000 - GHS 28,000 per year (estimated higher band for clinical health programmes)

salary.Ghana: GHS 42,000 - GHS 90,000 per year (clinical PA roles depending on facility and experience)
salary.USA: USD 90,000 - USD 130,000 per year (for PA roles; context differs from Ghana)

levels.cutt_off: Competitive WASSCE aggregate often between 8 - 18 with strong science grades, aligned with allied health benchmarks
levels.mode: In-person, clinically oriented training combining classroom teaching, laboratory sessions and supervised clinical rotations in accredited health facilities.
levels.entry_requirements: Applicants are generally expected to have credit passes in English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science, plus three science electives such as Biology, Chemistry and either Physics or Elective Mathematics at WASSCE level, with a competitive overall aggregate often not exceeding 24. Additional selection may be based on interviews and meeting professional council standards applicable to physician assistant training. [web:46]
levels.level_note: The programme blends basic medical sciences, clinical skills and patient care with extensive clinical placements. Graduates are prepared to sit relevant licensing examinations and work as physician assistants under the supervision of medical doctors.

career: Registered Nurse (after meeting Nursing and Midwifery Council requirements)
Public Health and Health Promotion Nurse
Charge Nurse or Ward Supervisor (with experience)

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 20,000 - GHS 26,000 per year (estimated for private nursing degree programmes)

salary.Ghana: GHS 30,000 - GHS 72,000 per year (nursing roles in public and private facilities)

levels.cutt_off: Typical nursing admission aggregates range from 10 - 24 with strong science passes, depending on yearly competition
levels.mode: Classroom and skills-lab based teaching with simulation, complemented by supervised clinical rotations in hospitals, clinics and community settings.
levels.entry_requirements: Prospective nursing students normally require six WASSCE passes including English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science, plus three science or health-related electives such as Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Elective Mathematics, General Agriculture or Health Science, with a good overall aggregate (often not exceeding mid-20s). Graduates are expected to meet Nursing and Midwifery Council requirements for registration upon completion. [web:46]
levels.level_note: The nursing programme covers foundational sciences, medical-surgical nursing, community health, maternal and child health, mental health and leadership in nursing. Emphasis is placed on compassionate, ethical and evidence-based patient care.

career: Quality Control Officer in Diagnostic or Pharmaceutical Labs

levels.fees: Ghanaian Students: GHS 20,000 - GHS 26,000 per year (estimated comparable to nursing and allied science programmes)

salary.Ghana: GHS 32,000 - GHS 72,000 per year (laboratory roles in hospitals and diagnostic centres)

levels.cutt_off: Typical WASSCE aggregate 12 - 24 with strong science subjects for allied health laboratory programmes
levels.mode: Laboratory-intensive, in-person training with significant practical work, instrumentation handling and supervised clinical laboratory placements.
levels.entry_requirements: Applicants usually require credit passes in English Language, Core Mathematics and Integrated Science, plus three science electives such as Biology, Chemistry and either Physics or Elective Mathematics, achieving an overall aggregate in the low to mid-20s for competitive allied health laboratory programmes. Professional registration requirements of relevant health councils must also be satisfied after graduation. [web:46][web:27]
levels.level_note: The programme provides in-depth training in clinical chemistry, haematology, microbiology, parasitology and laboratory management. Graduates are prepared to support diagnosis and monitoring of diseases in hospitals, clinics and public health laboratories.
